text:
Hey Snehal! I remember I first got to interact with you during your visits to Vishesh's room, discussing acads and whatnot. And I remember vividly you expressing genuine empathy for my CHM102 case since my switch to CSE was hanging by a thread. And man did your wishes work wonders! :)

The next sem I snooped into KD Lab only to find you sitting there. And I instantly vibed with you. CR7, tech, Football, MKBHD, Music, Famous food spots, memes among many other things. It was only gradually that I realise that your figure was much taller than these shared hobbies and interests.

If Keshav is Gawd, then you are nothing less than at least a Demigod. I'm using this because you will politely refuse the title of God for yourself :). I have always been fascinated by your organised and systematic approach to your goals, work, fun and things in general. You're work ethic and your dedication to your goals is impeccable.
I have literally seen you completing assignments and coursework when you have been dead sick. Your perspiration and kind nature have always been awe-inspiring for me.

DE Courses, ECO, Course projects and everything in acads, I could always come up to your seat whenever I was stuck in a problem or some code. Because of you, I could always lax a bit for course projects because you would only fret over it more than any other person at the end of the day and would work your ass off to complete it (and I did exploit it a bit :P).

And not just your brilliance or your hard work, you are one of the most humble guys I have met on campus and your journey from IITK to Oxford is a living manifestation of the culmination of your perspiration and the sacrifices you have made along the way.

I was really looking forward to hanging out with you but alas, covid messed it all up. But hey, that does not mean we can't hang out still? After all, all international flights pass through Delhi and a layover of a day or two won't harm anyone :P. All the best for your life ahead man, both personal and professional, not that you need any in the first place (:. And don't forget us muggles as you continue to climb those heights of greatness. Congratulations to Oxford for getting you to select them!

Cheers QuantumMachineLearningGawd!

text:
Hello Dear, Aao tumko bhi Closure de....

Well no :)

Sorry to disappoint you but I ain't gonna give you any closure. Because that's how precious your friendship means to me. While you did deviate a lot in your objectives from your first year to the last year (Quantum Physics and Stonks are poles apart! XD), you were on the constant hunt to search for that one thing that fulfilled you, and that's what separates you from the mainstream out there. Because people are usually content with what they have but you my friend are probably the only person I know at IITK who has dared to dream as big as being a Wall Street Banker. 

Thanks for letting me crash into your room, into your bed and into your DSLR :P. I guess almost every decent photo of mine has your magical hands and editing skills behind it. But I do give you PC every time so I guess we can call it even :P.

I am still not happy with you not being able to get Atif Aslam for Udgosh -.-
Utter Disappointment. Ughhh! Guess Karma is a bitch coz the entire Udgosh got cancelled. Hehe.

You're a great friend, bhai. Not everyone is as selfless as you. Heck, you are too selfless for your own good (YKWIM) and its high time you start asserting yourself and valuing yourself as much as I and people around value you. You are important. Never forget that. Thanks for introducing me to all sorts of English Classic Songs and making me fall in love with them again. Thank you for always being there for me to vent out my every rr and not only listening to it with jaw-dropping patience but also providing me with valuable feedback. Thank you for error checking my resumes and applications and what not innumerable times (Anyone else would have already kicked me out of their room by then :P).

At the end of the day, you did manage to bag what you chased after professionally. Sure there were hiccups along the way (and some major ones at that) but you never gave up. You tried again and again and again and are nothing but a living manifestation that hard work beats talent when talent does beat hard work.

All the best for your life ahead bhai, both personal and professional. I ain't letting go of you anytime soon since I need way too many great pics needed to be clicked for myself :P. Come to Delhi soon and we'll hang out like there's no tomorrow. Cheers! :D
